description: Unique identifier for this preventive maintenance schedule record.
Date and time the record was last updated (YYYYMMDDHHMMSSmmm).
Short description of the maintenance schedule or task.
XML payload storing the detailed schedule configuration, triggers, and rules.
Identifier for an optional D-level task linked to this schedule; 0 indicates none.
Reference table used to resolve taskd.
Identifier for an optional C-level task linked to this schedule; 0 indicates none.
Reference table used to resolve taskc.
Identifier for an optional B-level task linked to this schedule; 0 indicates none.
Reference table used to resolve taskb.
Identifier for an optional A-level task linked to this schedule; 0 indicates none.
Reference table used to resolve taska.
Primary task code or ID associated with this schedule.
Reference table used to resolve the task field.
Identifier of the schedule set to which this record belongs.
Reference table used to resolve schedset.
Key from the legacy source system for this record, if migrated.
Legacy source table of this record, if migrated.
Unit or basis used for quick schedule entry (for example, meter or time).
Unit used for elapsed-time scheduling (such as months or years).
Unit of the fourth meter trigger (for example, miles or hours); none when unused.
Unit of the third meter trigger; none when unused.
Unit of the second meter trigger; none when unused.
Unit of the primary meter trigger (for example, miles or hours).
Scheduling basis indicator: meter-based, elapsed-time, date-based, or combinations thereof.
Schedule builder category or preset applied to this configuration.
Numeric interval or quantity for quick schedule entry, paired with shortcut_schedule_in_type.
Days to look ahead when forecasting or alerting upcoming maintenance.
Interval value for elapsed-time scheduling, interpreted using schedule_builder_elapsed_time_type.
Fuel usage threshold for scheduling, if enabled; units depend on configuration. Likely optional; confirm with SME.
Meter threshold for the fourth trigger; 0 or very large values typically indicate unused.
Meter threshold for the third trigger; 0 or very large values typically indicate unused.
Meter threshold for the second trigger; 0 or very large values typically indicate unused.
Meter threshold for the primary trigger (for example, miles).
Flag indicating whether the schedule definition has been modified since creation or last publish.
Indicates the schedule recurs after completion.
Indicates seasonal availability rules should be ignored when building the schedule.
Specific date used as a fixed start or due date (YYYYMMDD), blank when not set.
Identifier of the last applied service pattern for this schedule; likely a foreign key; confirm with SME.
Reference table used to resolve service_pattern_last; confirm with SME.
